functions
Class Function.SimpleFunction

java.lang.Object
  functions.Function.SimpleFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Function
Direct Known Subclasses:
CrossedRidgeFunction, RadialFunction, RadialSineFunction, SineFunction, SineFunction2, SineInSineFunction
Enclosing interface:
Function
public abstract static class Function.SimpleFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements Function

* This class encapsulates methods for simple testfunctions with 1-dimensional output. Extending classes need to implement the evaluate(double[]) method to define the function.

If your function evaluation is noisy for any reason, set the noiseDeviation to zero. Note that the noiselessFunctionValue() is used for performance evaluation only.

Author:
Patrick Stalph

Method Detail

nextProblemInstance

public StateDescriptor nextProblemInstance()
Description copied from interface: Function
Returns the next problem instance for XCSF to learn. For theoretical problems this will usually be a randomly generated input and the corresponding scaled (and possibly noisy) output.

Specified by:
nextProblemInstance in interface Function
Returns:
The next problem instance
See Also:
StateDescriptor

noiselessFunctionValue

public double[] noiselessFunctionValue()
Description copied from interface: Function
Returns the function value(s) as a double vector without noise. The function value refers to the last problem input instance generated.

Specified by:
noiselessFunctionValue in interface Function
Returns:
The noiseless function value(s)
